newsitem.title: UK: Eurotunnel March cars down, Eurostar up.
newsitem.headline: Eurotunnel March cars down, Eurostar up.

text.p: Eurotunnel Plc, the Anglo-French channel tunnel operator, said on Thurday that the volume of cars carried on its Le Shuttle so far in 1997 was 357,068 cars and 7,727 coaches.
In its monthly traffic data, the operator said Le Shuttle carried 149,619 cars and 4,177 coaches in March, down from 152,875 cars and 5,619 cars in the same month a year ago.
It said that the level of traffic carried by Le Shuttle in March of 153,796 vehicles was an increase of 21 percent over February.
Eurostar passenger volume rose to 500,899 passengers in March from 389,069 a year ago. It was also higher than in February 1997.
Eurotunnel's freight shuttle operations remain suspended after last year's fire. It said in a separate statement that it will re-open HGV shuttle services before mid-June 1997.
Bulk freight trains operated by Railfreight carried more in March, for a total of 230,753 tonnes compared with 207,417 a year ago.
